intro: Hieracium isorigidum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium isorigidum is often found in disturbed habitats and can form dense colonies, making it a common weed in certain regions.
